title: Autologin is not working any more
author: DERDomink
body_snippet:
Autologin is not working any more

## Expected Behavior
When saving the credentials I expect that I do not have to enter the credentials when connecting

## Current Behavior
Since 2 weeks (I made no changes) autologin is not possible for one maschine. When connecting the windows login screen appears and I have to enter username and password.
Other maschines are working.

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
Everytime I connect it asks for credentials. Same machine and same credentials work...

iterations.description: Regression where stored credentials are not automatically sent on connection; ClearTextPassword/UserName flow in RdpProtocol.cs likely broken by SecureString→string refactor or credential inheritance chain.

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
The only thing that I can think of is maybe [inheritance](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/wiki/Folders-and-Inheritance) has been accidentally/incorrectly configured for this connection.

Maybe change from always connect to warn or don't connect might provide a more specific error message?

comments.author: DERDomink
comments.snippet:
Thank you for your reply.

Cause of inheritance I created the same connection in "root" but without success.
Moreover I changed to warning when authentification problems but I get no warning oder other log entries.

Sometimes I get an exception in log:
"2
Ein interner Fehler ist aufgetreten."
But I dont get this error when starting mremote, connect to the concerned machine and close mremote.

Could a complete deinstallation and reinstall help?

notes:
AI triage (claude): Regression where stored credentials are not automatically sent on connection; ClearTextPassword/UserName flow in RdpProtocol.cs likely broken by SecureString→string refactor or credential inheritance chain.
Approach: Trace the credential assignment path (lines 833-988 in RdpProtocol.cs): verify _rdpClient.UserName, .Domain, and AdvancedSettings2.ClearTextPassword are all set before Connect() is called; check that UseCredSsp and AuthenticationLevel are not blocking NLA credential pass-through.
